Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black part of lotus flower and lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre above two white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (part of chest, wing with red patch and forelegs remaining) to left; on left, trace of outline of undetermined motif.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 289, no. 874)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1017) (phase 2)
